Trump confirms the CIA is conducting covert operations inside Venezuela
Subhead: Asked on Wednesday if he had authorized the CIA to take action in Venezuela, Trump confirmed he had made the move, also stating that the administration 'is looking at land' as it considers further strikes in the region. Trump declined, however, to say whether the CIA has the authority to take action against President Nicolás Maduro.

Title: Japanese rugby relies on France to move forward
Subhead: Partnerships linking Japanese professional clubs with Stade Toulousain, the reigning three-time French champions, and Lyon Olympique Universitaire aim to raise the level of the national team, the Brave Blossoms.

Title: 'The Deal' explores the 'reactor core' of international diplomacy
Subhead: Set during the final phase of negotiations over Iran's nuclear program in 2015, Swiss filmmaker Jean-Stéphane Bron's series masterfully uses fiction to render the world more intelligible.

Title: Taxing the super-rich? The 'Zucman tax' explained
Subhead: A proposal to tax the super-rich by a French economist called Gabriel Zucman has taken center stage in debates about France's budget as Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu tries to stifle another governmental crisis.

Title: Berthe Weill at the Musée de l'Orangerie, the treasures of an eclectic gallerist
Subhead: The institution shines a light on the art dealer (1865-1951) who exhibited works by Matisse and Picasso from 1900 onward, as well as on many artists from the different movements of her era.

Title: Canada's hottest village lives on despite the constant fear of wildfires
Subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (2/6) Lytton, British Columbia, was consumed by flames in 2021. As the fires have grown ever more destructive, some residents have returned, determined to stay.
